snippet: The campaign ads are part of a full effort by the candidates and their “super PACs” to break through in what could be the kind of climactic contest that the New Hampshire primary was not.
abstract: Roundup up of political ads are inundating the airwaves in South Carolina, where Republican presidential candidates and their super PACs are attempting to break through in what may turn out to be a climactic contest.
lead_paragraph: The campaign ads are part of a full effort by the candidates and their “super PACs” to break through in what could be the kind of climactic contest that the New Hampshire primary was not.

headline.seo: Campaign Appeals Inundate South Carolina Voters
headline.main: Expensive and Bitter Media War Already Ignited
headline.print_headline: Campaigns and ‘Super PACs’ Inundate Airwaves in South Carolina
